grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 釜中の魚【フチュウノウオ】fish in a pot about to be boiled, person who is blissfully unaware of deadly danger
kun reading compounds: 釜揚げうどん【かまあげうどん】straight-from-the-pot udon, udon noodles pulled straight from the pot and served in the hot water used for boiling (traditionally without being soaked in cold water), eaten by dipping in sauce
御釜【おかま】pot, volcanic crater, (one's) buttocks, male homosexual, effeminate man, male transvestite
一つ釜【ひとつかま】one or the same pot, eating or living together
